item.title: Gravitas
item.description:
Inspired by watching Notch start a game for LD30 in Dart, I decided to revisit this language and work on re-writing a game a had written years ago with Processing. Alas I was not able to devote the full weekend to the project, and ended up with little more than the base mechanics and display completed. Regardless, it was a fun weekend project.

The basic mechanic of the game is to utilize gravitational attraction between bodies to deliver a missile to a designated target. Right now it is more of a demo, where you can fire missiles from a planet and watch them follow gravitational orbits.

See it in action.

Source at GitHub.

item.title: Resume
item.description:
Kevin M. Retzke

kevin.retzke@gmail.com

www.kmr.me

LinkedIn

MISSION

I am a driven, creative individual seeking to apply engineering principles to solve challenging real-world problems. I enjoy obtaining new knowledge and skills to enrich myself, Â personally and professionally, and am eager to apply knowledge across disciplines.

EDUCATION

BS Nuclear Engineering, Purdue University, 2004

SKILLS

Programming languages

Python, Go, C++, SQL, Fortran, Objective-C, BASH, AWK, HTML, CSS, JavaScript

Technologies

SQLite, PostgreSQL, Qt, VTK, OpenCascade, Cocoa, Django, Ruby on Rails

Operating Systems

Windows, Linux, OpenBSD, Mac OS X

Applications

Microsoft Office, OpenOffice, LaTeX, R, iPython, Gnuplot, Vim, Emacs, Git

EXPERIENCE

Engineer, TransWare Enterprises Inc, 01/2005 - 04/2014

  • Performed and reviewed engineering analyses related to nuclear reactor operation.
  • Applied engineering principles to develop methodologies to solve new challenges.
  • Designed and developed software applications for performing engineering evaluations, data reporting and visualization, and web services.
  • Performed software testing and verification, and prepared software documentation.
  • Assisted in administration of 30-node Linux compute cluster and with Windows, Mac OS X, and Linux desktop support.
  • Managed project goals, schedules, and coordinated with client representatives.
  • Performed work in accordance with all applicable federal regulations, NRC and industry guidelines, and corporate and client QA programs.

Nuclear Engineering Co-op, Xcel Energy, 08/2000 - 08/2003

Two four-month terms in the Reactor Engineering department at Prairie Island Nuclear Generating Plant.

  • Assisted reactor engineers in daily tasks, including cooperation with various work groups.
  • Initiated and developed database for tracking fuel assembly location, history, and information record keeping, replacing several spreadsheets and paper logs.

Three four-month terms in the Nuclear Analysis and Design group at the corporate office in Minneapolis, MN.

  • Performed and reviewed reactor core physics calculations and general engineering evaluations.
  • Developed numerous software applications and scripts for performing analyses, retrieving data, and visualizing results.

item.title: Baby Rattles
item.description:
Turned from a single piece of wood, rattles are a fun, quick (2-4 hours) project that is sure to impress. I made one a couple years ago when friends had a baby, and decided to make another for my new niece!

Detailed steps

item.title: CloudFlare DDNS Client
item.description: Simple dynamic DNS client using the CloudFlare client API, written in Go (golang). Source at GitHub.

item.title: Spent Fuel Pool Decay Heat
item.description:
Generated in Excel from ORIGEN decay heat calculations based on collected fuel assembly data.

Image copyright TransWare Enterprises Inc. Used with permission.

item.title: Cask 3D Geometry
item.description:
Visualization in ParaView of VTK file generated with Python script that I wrote that reads proprietary data files of 3D model and calculation results.

Image copyright TransWare Enterprises Inc. Used with permission.

item.title: Dining Table
item.description:
I needed a dining table for the house I was buying, so of course I decided to make one. I used boards leftover from previous projects, which drove the table design and dimensions. This project used up all the large boards I had lying around, and I didn’t have to buy any new material, which I thought was pretty incredible.

Build details

item.title: Cask 3D Dose
item.description:
Visualization in ParaView of VTK file generated with Python script that I wrote that reads proprietary data files of 3D model and calculation results.

Image copyright TransWare Enterprises Inc. Used with permission.

item.title: Spent Fuel Population Statistics
item.description:
Generated in R from collected fuel assembly data.

Image copyright TransWare Enterprises Inc. Used with permission.

item.title: Cask Diagram
item.description:
Drawn in DraftSight, based on dimensions and materials from fabrication drawings. The drawing was used to build a 3D analytic model in the MCNP particle transport code, which was used to compute neutron and gamma dose rates.

Image copyright TransWare Enterprises Inc. Used with permission.

item.title: BWR RPV Rollout
item.description:
Generated with Gnuplot from proprietary data files with BASH script.

Image copyright TransWare Enterprises Inc. Used with permission.
